ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Crawl using Proxy
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, The error that you are seeing is a retry-able fetch error. By default there are 30 retires with a 15 minute wait between them. Both of these settings

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Crawl using Proxy
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137477665; y=NTbm2_9rosMYrNEVqi5fe_5Ojp4g3rVWYKq_daqkmp4fTB6n-w
X-Yahoo-Profile: iranitovic

Hello,

The error that you are seeing is a retry-able fetch error. By default 
there are 30 retires with a 15 minute wait between them. Both of these 
settings are configurable.

If you are having only one host (one queue), then the crawler will be 
idle for 15 minutes after each of these errors happen. This is why you 
might think that the crawl has stopped.

Now, I am pretty sure that pausing and resuming the job should not 
change this behavior, but if it does it is a bug.

What version of Heritrix are you using?

Igor

thiru_sundaram wrote:
> Hi all,
> I setup configuration to crawl a website using proxy. But some time i
> get the below exception [ in local-errors.log]. Heritrix stops
> crawling after that. If i pause and resume the job through UI, it
> again starts from the point it left out. Any idea why socket time out
> exception for one url makes heritrix stop crawling ?
> 
> I have given below the error pattern
> 2006-08-28T12:30:23.174Z    -2          - "url1" L "url2" no-type #022
> - - - le:SocketTimeoutException@HTTP
>         at java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out

> org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:306)
